Package eu.datacrop.maize.model_repository.api.controllers

Class SystemController

java.lang.Object
eu.datacrop.maize.model_repository.api.controllers.SystemController
@RestController @RequestMapping("model_repository/v1/asset_management/system") public class SystemController extends Object
This class intercepts API HTTP Requests pertaining to IoT Systems.
Since:
version 0.3.0
Author:
Angela-Maria Despotopoulou [Athens, Greece]

  • Method Details

    • retrieveSystemByID

      @ResponseStatus(OK) @GetMapping(path="/{systemID}/id/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity retrieveSystemByID(@PathVariable String systemID)
      Method to intercept a GET Request that aims to retrieve an existing System using its databaseID as unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      systemID - A UUID that uniquely identifies an existing System in the persistence layer, not null.
      Returns:
      A data structure to be transmitted from server to client as response.

    • retrieveSystemByName

      @ResponseStatus(OK) @GetMapping(path="/{name}/name/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity retrieveSystemByName(@PathVariable String name)
      Method to intercept a GET Request that aims to retrieve an existing System using its name as unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      name - A human-readable name that uniquely identifies an existing System in the persistence layer, not null.
      Returns:
      A data structure to be transmitted from server to client as response.

    • retrieveAllSystems

      @ResponseStatus(OK) @GetMapping(path="/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity retrieveAllSystems(@RequestParam(value="page",defaultValue="0") int page, @RequestParam(value="size",defaultValue="10") int size)
      Method to intercept a GET Request that aims to retrieve all existing Systems.
      Returns:
      A data structure to be transmitted from server to client as response.

    • createSystem

      @ResponseStatus(CREATED) @PostMapping(path="/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity createSystem(@RequestBody SystemRequestDto requestDto)
      Method to intercept a POST Request that aims to persist a new System.
      Parameters:
      requestDto - A data transfer object with values for the attributes of the System, not null.
      Returns:
      A data structure to be transmitted from server to client as response.

    • updateSystem

      @ResponseStatus(OK) @PutMapping(path="/{systemID}/id/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity updateSystem(@RequestBody SystemRequestDto requestDto, @PathVariable String systemID)
      Method to intercept a PUT Request that aims to update an existing System using its databaseID as unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      requestDto - A data transfer object with values for the attributes of the System, not null.
      systemID - A UUID that uniquely identifies an existing System in the persistence layer, not null.
      Returns:
      A data structure to be transmitted from server to client as response.

    • deleteSystem

      @ResponseStatus(OK) @DeleteMapping(path="/{systemID}/id/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteSystem(@PathVariable String systemID)
      Method to intercept a GET Request that aims to delete an existing System using its databaseID as unique identifier.
      Parameters:
      systemID - A UUID that uniquely identifies an existing System in the persistence layer, not null.
      Returns:
      A data structure to be transmitted from server to client as response.

    • deleteAllSystems

      @ResponseStatus(NO_CONTENT) @DeleteMapping(path="/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteAllSystems()
      Method to intercept a GET Request that aims to delete all existing System entities.
      Returns:
      A data structure to be transmitted from server to client as response.
